newsitem.title: POLAND: Zloty again forced below resistance by NBP buying.
newsitem.headline: Zloty again forced below resistance by NBP buying.

text.p: The Polish zloty again came under upward pressure by foreign investor payments for T-bonds, but its gradual rise met another currency-buying intervention.
Dealers said that the market remained in a currency-selling mood even after the $15 million intervention, but did not test higher levels, wary of sparking more central bank buying.
"The zloty remained strong all day, but its gains were capped by the National Bank of Poland's intervention," said Zbigniew Choszcz, chief dealer at Bank Gdanski SA.
The zloty closed at 2.53/2.50 percent from the trading band centre, flat from Wednesday's 2.53/2.49 percent close.
It closed at 3.1540/50 to the dollar, up from 3.1565/75 on Wednesday and at 1.8415/20 to the mark, down from 1.8350/60.
The NBP bought dollars at 3.1549 and 3.1555 zlotys.

Dealers said it was not clear whether the market's currency-selling sentiment would set off another round of interventions on Friday, as most of foreign investors aleady made forex deals ahead of the tender's May 12 value date.
On the money market rates held flat around 23 percent during the day. Overnight rates closed at 22.9/23.30 percent and tomorrow/next at 23.0/23.30.
